metadata.title: CVE-2014-0039 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Untrusted search path vulnerability in fwsnort before 1.6.4, when notrunning as root, allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a Trojanhorse fwsnort.conf in the current working directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fwsnort - 1.6.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fwsnort package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.4-1').
